intro: Blakea gracilis var. longifolia, commonly known as the slender blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas or near streams. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
